meanings.sent1: The loud music can irritate my ears.
meanings.sent2: Please don't irritate your little sister while she's studying.
meanings.sent3: His constant tapping on the desk started to irritate the whole class.
meanings.sent4: The repetitive sound of the dripping faucet began to irritate her nerves.
meanings.sent5: The buzzing mosquito continued to irritate me as I tried to sleep.

meanings.definition: To cause inflammation or discomfort in a part of the body
meanings.sent1: Certain fabrics can irritate sensitive skin.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to irritate the rash by scratching it.
meanings.sent3: The new detergent unexpectedly started to irritate my skin.
meanings.sent4: The rough edges of the bandage began to irritate the wound.
meanings.sent5: The pollen in the air can irritate my allergies and make me sneeze.
